title.narrative: CAPACITY BUILDING OF THE MSPP FOR EMERGENCY NUTRITIONAL RESPONSE TO THE DROUGHT SITUATION IN HAITI FOLLOWING THE EL NINO

description.narrative: Action Against Hunger will strengthen the network of leading mothers, instituted in the Kore Lavi project, to sensitize a large number of households for health nutrition and hygiene practices. Additionally, with the support of the MSPP, the project will pilot an innovative approach to empower mothers to screen their own children for malnutrition through the use of MUAC. In order to support health departments and prepare them for an increasing integration of SAM treatment and system strengthening, Action Against Hunger will work with the North-West Health Department to assess and diagnose and strengthen the entire health system.
Children Under 5, Pregnant and Lactating Women

Haití has been facing the effects of "El niño" since 2014, affecting most departments with acute drought and increased food insecurity and deterioration of the nutritional status of vulnerable populations. The departments of Artibonite and North-West are among the most impacted.
According to the analysis of the Government of Haiti’s MSPP Nutrition Directorate, the monitoring, information exchange and reporting system is weak and does not function properly in the departments; the coverage of the Global Acute Malnutrition Management Program is weak; and the response capacities of the state and other actors are quite weak and unequally distributed. The statistics compiled by UCPNANU for the months of January, February and March 2016 show that the performance of acute malnutrition treatment services in the departments of Artibonite and North-West are well below the standards set by MSPP and, as indeed in almost all departments of the country, there is need to strengthen the quality of care, especially in this emergency.
